H0.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Bone Marrow

H1.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Spleen

H2.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. Thymus

H3.text: where are antibodies made and by what type of lymphocyte. lymph

A4.text: Plasma cells migrate to the bone marrow

A5.text: B cells are found in the marginal zone of the spleen

A6.text: Human marrow produces approximately 500 billion blood cells per day

A7.text: All types of hematopoietic cells, including both myeloid and lymphoid lineages, are created in bone marrow
